title.narrative: F.a: EDAN: Inclusion of Persons with Disabilities in Development Programmes (IPDDP)

description.narrative: The livelihood and quality of life of disabled people is insufficient in eastern Africa. The development cooperation programs of the churches dont consider disabled people as actors, rather they continue to see them as objects of charity. The goal of the p roject is that the livelihood and improvement in quality of life of disabled people will become a reality. The intention of the project is to have an effect of the goal of achieving full possibility of participation in society and equal rights for disabled people, and to empower them so that their livelihood can improve. The implementation of this will begin by, eg. influencing the planners of development cooperation projects in inclusive development cooperation planning forums within each country. Expected development effects: improvement in livelihood prospects of disabled people in Tanzania, Kehya, and Uganda by mainstreaming the disability perspective in local chuch development cooperation programs. Results of activities (i) disabled people receive the s kills to educate others in advocacy work for the benefit of inclusive development, (ii) disabled people and development cooperation actos commit to the consideration of disabled people in accordance with development cooperation goals, (iii) disability orga nizations, churches, church organizations, and NGOs develop and adopt inclusive instructions in eastern Africa, (iv) the EDAN network has created a report on disability inclusiveness and its best practices in eastern Africa, and (v) project partners have l earned best practices. The project is implemented through disability organizations in cooperation with churches and other civil actors in three target countries (UIganda, Tanzania, Kenya). The target groups are disabled people, civil servants, political le aders, traditional leaders, and NGO leaders. The project is implemented by Ecumenical Disability Advocates Network EDAN, which is a World Church Council program. EDAN has broad networks in the area with area and international disability actors. Its head of fice is located in Nairobi, and the new phase of this project will also be coordinated and managed there.
